title: How to cite a book in MLA 8 - Quora

response.answer_text: MLA standard citation format for a print book: Last Name, First Name. Title of Book. City of Publication, Publisher, Publication Date. This includes the changes for the 8th edition, which were: Commas are used instead of periods between Publisher, Publication Date, and Pagination.Medium is no longer necessary.Containers are now a part of the MLA process. Commas should be used after container titles.DOIs should be used instead of URLS when available.Use the term “Accessed” instead of listing the date or the abbreviation, “n.d."For more help on citation in any format I recommend Perdue University’s resources. They have a lot of information on their online writing lab. Research and Citation Resources // Purdue Writing Lab I will also recommend the citation machine, with an abundance of caution. It can be a quick way to assemble a citation list in the proper format, but you need to be careful to review the results to make sure it’s correct. Sometimes formatting can be lost in the copy/paste process, especially font, font size, and spacing. Citation Machine®: Format & Generate
